data.title: Afghanistan
data.meta_description:
Afghanistan’s currency is called the Afghan Afghani (afn) and was created in 1925 to replace the Afghan rupee. Although the Afghan Afghanis has many coins and older banknotes, we will focus on the current banknote set series of 2002. This series has the denominations of 1, 2, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 500 and 1000 with the 1, 2 and 5 afghani banknotes being the only banknotes replaced by coins. 
The 10 Afghani note features the Mausoleum of Mirwais Khan Hotaki and on the back is an image of Paghman with monuments dedicated to Afghanistan’s fallen soldiers. The 20 Afghani note features the Mausoleum of Sultan Mahmud in Ghazni and on the back is the Citadel of the King. The 50 note features Shah-do-Shamsira Mosque and the Hindu Kush mountains. The 100 Afghani banknote has the Pul-e Khishti Mosque on the obverse and the reverse has the Arch of Qala-e-Bost. The 500 note has the “Friday Mosque” on the front and the control tower of Kandahar Airport on the back. Lastly, the 1000 Afghani note features the Noble Shrine on the front and on the back is the Mausoleum of Ahmad Shah Duarrani.
data.text:
NOTE TO PROSPECTIVE PURCHASERS OF BANKNOTES THAT ARE STILL IN CIRCULATION

There may be widespread, unfounded claims that circulating currencies such as the Indonesian rupiah, Iraqi dinars and/or Vietnamese dong will increase in value relative to the US dollar. Banknote World wishes to warn potential purchasers of such circulating banknotes against expecting that these currencies will be revalued or otherwise increase significantly in value as a currency. Banknote World sells such currencies as collectibles at prices that are already above their face value given the quality preservation and authentication services we provide. Purchasers are advised that while the value of banknotes as collectibles may go up and down based on collector interest, significant increases in value as a circulating currency are NOT likely

Banknote World does not guarantee any future price or value with respect to any banknote that it sells. By purchasing circulating or non-circulating currency from us, you confirm your understanding that Banknote World sells banknotes as collectibles and that the purchasing of banknotes for any reasons other than for collecting purposes is highly speculative. You also confirm you understanding that Banknote World does not guarantee any future price or value with respect to any banknote that it sells. You agree that your purchase of any banknotes and/or coins from Banknote World is for collectible purposes only.
